alert.note: Alert for Central and Southern Scott County; Eastern, Central, and Southern Searcy County Higher Elevations; Johnson County Higher Elevations; Newton County Higher Elevations; Northern Scott County; Northwest Yell County; Pope County Higher Elevations; Southern Johnson County; Southern Pope County; Southern and Eastern Logan County; Western and Northern Logan County; Yell Excluding Northwest (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 24 at 8:21AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Logan, west central Searcy, southeastern Newton, Johnson, eastern Scott, western Yell and northwestern Pope Counties through 845 AM CDT... At 820 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles northwest of Woodland to 6 miles south of Waldron. Movement was east at 65 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, torrential rainfall, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Clarksville... Booneville... Waldron... Paris... Danville... Lamar... London... Magazine... Knoxville... Subiaco... Hartman... Scranton... Ratcliff... Blue Mountain... Cardiff... Moore... Devils Knob... Hoyt... Midway in Logan County... Holman... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
